title: Disney Holidays: bringing Disney films to life
text: Everybody has a favourite Disney film, one with characters they adore and a special story that touched their heart. In fact, many people have a lot more than one favourite. And the beauty of the Disney holiday experience is seeing those favourite characters and stories coming to life in front of your eyes, whether at Walt Disney World or on a Disney cruise. A galaxy far, far away has also been brought to Disney, creating adventures for Star Wars fans Do you want to have an adventure with Woody? You can at Toy Story Midway Mania in Disney’s Hollywood Studios, where you join the cowboy and his friends for a host of fun-filled games and rides. On board the ships, lucky Oceaneers Club kids (aged from three to 12 years) can even play in Andy’s Room. Do you love Nemo and his friends? You can find him at Walt Disney World too. Young children will love interacting with everybody’s favourite turtle at Turtle Talk with Crush, where the shelled creature appears underwater and uses a special microphone to communicate individually with the little dudes and dudettes – answering their questions about life under the sea. At dinner on the cruise ships, one of the main family restaurants is Animator’s Palate, brings sketches of Crush and other Disney favourites to life in front of your very eyes for a special animation across the eatery’s walls. Disney Dream even has Nemo’s Reef, a special water play area for young children. Wannabe superheroes can train with Captain America to become Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D at the Avengers Academy on board Disney Magic, while mermaids-in-training can go Under The Sea without stepping foot off land at Magic Kingdom, for a musical adventure following the journey of The Little Mermaid in Walt Disney World. Calling all superheroes: become Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D at the Avengers Academy Frozen fans will love the opportunity to meet Anna and Elsa at Disney’s Princess Fairytale Hall in Magic Kingdom. The royal sisters even have their own float in the Festival of Fantasy Parade and their own Frozen Summer Fun, which includes a live sing-along celebration and a Frozen fireworks spectacular. In 2016, Frozen Ever After will open at Epcot, a special attraction that will whisk families through the magical world of Arandelle and visit Elsa’s Ice Palace. Disney Cruise Line guests are also enjoying spectacular Frozen -themed events on selected cruises from this summer. Each participating ship is transformed into a winter wonderland complete with sparkling icicles, giant snowflakes and snow-covered rocks, with the chance to meet Anna, Elsa, Kristoff and, of course, Olaf. Frozen games include Freezing the Night Away, a family-friendly interactive deck party with special Nordic guests. You can even enjoy Olaf’s Summertime Freeze bar at Castaway Cay, Disney’s private island escape, serving non-alcoholic specialty frozen drinks such as Olaf’s Flurry Freeze, Sven’s Carrot Delight and Warm Hugs in souvenir cups. A galaxy far, far away has also been brought to Disney, creating amazing intergalactic adventures for Star Wars fans. Reach for the stars: a Millennium Falcon will soon be on board Disney Dream At Hollywood Studios, take a space flight aboard a Starspeeder 1000 on Star Tours: The Adventure Continues. Expect to visit the Wookies and Tatooine, and come face to face with the likes of Yoda, Princess Leia or even Darth Vader – with 50-plus storylines, your experience will never the same twice. Themed food locations and an amazing galaxy will pop up across Tomorrowland for the special event too. Other themed activities in Hollywood Studios see volunteers aged four to 12 becoming junior Jedi Knights during a 20-minute guest-participation show where they can face Darth Vader himself. The intergalactic battle has even taken to the world’s oceans on selected Disney Cruise ships. Marking the first official appearance of the heroes and villains of Star Wars aboard a Disney Cruise Line ship, Star Wars Day at Sea is a new experience that will include themed activities such as a deck party, meet and greets with favourite characters, merchandise and screenings of Star Wars Episode VII: The Force Awakens . The Star Wars experience is coming to life in another way on Disney Dream, which will unveil a Millennium Falcon on board from November this year. Young members of Disney’s Oceaneers Club – will be able to join the Rebel Alliance and even navigate the spaceship through the galaxy. • Find out more about Disney Cruises, Disney holidays and Walt Disney World
